intro: Beyeria sulcata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its leaves are often marked with distinctive patterns and can vary in color from green to silver. Beyeria sulcata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
